title: Social Integration Strategies in Individualized Science Learning: Collaboration Enhancement Through Experimentation and Observation

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level science knowledge (experimental design, data analysis) and problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: A job-preparation-focused course for strengthening scientific job competencies. Requires flexible lesson design considering individual learning pace differences, with a fundamental understanding of the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis setting → experimentation → analysis → conclusion).

learning_goals: Learners propose ≥3 experimental design adjustments reflecting peer feedback when creating individualized learning plans.
Learners share scientific observation data with peers using real-time collaboration tools (e.g., Padlet) at least twice weekly.

Learners write a variable control plan with team members during project-based assessment tasks, submit ≥4 weekly experiment meeting logs, and achieve ≥4 points (5-point scale) in ≥4 of 5 peer evaluation rubric items.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
